metadata.name: Ego Integrity vs. Despair
metadata.description:
EGO INTEGRITY VS. DESPAIR is a short experimental documentary, capturing a wide spectrum of the human condition over the course of a single day in the Bronx, NY. Psychologist Erik Erikson theorized that we all go through eight separate psychosocial stages over the course of human development. Ego Integrity vs. Despair is the last of those stages.

This film is a standalone work as part of THE ABSENCE IS ALWAYS PRESENT film project directed by award-winning SXSW documentary filmmaker Jason Charnick (www.upstartfilmcollective.com) with music by Jason David White (soundcloud.com/jasondavidwhite).

THE ABSENCE IS ALWAYS PRESENT introduces a new paradigm of fundraising for independent cinema. It is a multi-year, multi-disciplinary concept that marries art, photography and film in fresh, new, exciting ways utilizing blockchain and NFT technologies.

This NFT includes Associate Producer credit on the Absence short film, and a 30-minute post production/NFT strategy consultation session or file encoding assistance for your own work.

Read our project roadmap at:â€¨
https://absence.movie
